column4: can anyone think of a reason why a filesystem would -appear- to be mounted rw, but would actually be ro? Ubuntu 8.10.
I tried remountinng already
a filesystem that encounters errors may be remounted read-only. check dmesg, you may need an fsck
when I umounted the partition and ran fdisk, I got this: /sbin/fdisk: Input/output error
any suggestions? :/
dmesg | grep sdc (or whatever device)
/bin/dmesg: Input/output error
you force unmounted your root partition?
I have not (yet). Should I?
no, i'm trying to understand your error.
yeah, lots of commands just return that input/output error >___<;;
very worrisome
btw, this is on an amazon ec2 server. So I don't think it's the hardware
oh ok. sounds your mount to / got severed. sounds like a restart is in order, i don't know what else to recommend.
hmmm
before i knew ec2, i was going to recommend shutting down forcibly, booting livecd, and checking your filesystems
hm
is there a more foolproof way to restart than telinit 6? it didn't error, but it also didn't restart
/sbin/reboot returned a input/output error >__<;
those are the two ways I do things
did you *do* something significant to the system before it started to fall apart?
nope
